pr_title: feat: Support [IF EXISTS] on DROP TYPE command

timeline.body: nit: not visible for testing only. Used by production code,, right?
timeline.bodyText: nit: not visible for testing only. Used by production code,, right?
timeline.bodyHTML: nit: not visible for testing only. Used by production code,, right?
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.bodyHTML:
No need to search the metastore when ifExists is true.

Suggested change
if (!metaStore.resolveType(typeName).isPresent()) {
if (!ifExists) {
throw new KsqlException("Type " + typeName + " does not exist.");
}
}
if (!ifExists && !metaStore.resolveType(typeName).isPresent()) {
throw new KsqlException("Type " + typeName + " does not exist.");
}
timeline.author: big-andy-coates

timeline.body:
I'm a little confused by the name of this test.   What's the `OnMissingName` mean?

It looks to test that the function returns a cmd when `ifExists` is `true` and the type does exist.  That being the case, maybe call it `shouldCreateDropTypeForExistingTypeAndIfExistsSet` or similar?
